_header: Unkind man take heed of me
Note: For another version, wholly distinct, see 4849; for another, see 6110.
_description: Appeal of Christ to Man from the Cross — seven couplets

BLHar4012.First Lines:
Vnkinde man take hed of meeLoke what payne I suffer for
                    the…
BLHar4012.Last Lines:
…Within myne hit greuith me more þat I vnkindnes finde in
                    theþat for thi loue hongid vpon a tree
BLHar4012.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 158.

LibCong4.Transcription: Vnkynde man take tent to meLoke what payne I thole for yhesynfull man to þe I cryeFor onely for þi luue I dyeByhold þe blode of my hondes donne rennesNoght for my gilt bot for your synnesfote and hondes wid nailes so are festþat syn and vayne both þai brestþe blode fro my hert roetelo it stremes doune to my foteOuer alle þere paynes þat I thole sarewid ynne my hert it greues sareþat I vnkyndnesse fynde in yeþat for þi luue hangis on tree
